definition[0]: if a ship, bus etc plies between two places or across a place, it does that journey regularly
example[0]: Two ferries ply between Tripoli and Malta every day.
definition[2]: a unit for measuring the thickness of thread, rope, plywood etc, based on the number of threads or layers that it has
example[2]: 60 retailers were plying their products on the radio.
definition[4]: to work at your job or business
example[3]: two outdoor barbers plying their trade on the beach
definition[5]: if a vehicle or boat plies between two places, it makes the journey regularly
example[4]: ferries plying between Dover and Calais
example[5]: The airline is not allowed to ply domestic routes.
